reviewText: When I saw this, I thought Cool a CCG!". Then I found out it's one of those where you don't interact during battles. And then I found out it's actually not a card game at all.\nWhat is it though? It's a strategical combat puzzle game
date: where you place up to 5 characters with different stats and special skills in a specific formation in order to fight an opposing team. You don't interact during the battle
recommended: it automatically plays out following specific rules. So the gameplay consists of figuring out a good team combination and and formation to overcome your opponents. Thanks to pretty interesting mechanics and a good variety of very different characters this is a surprisingly interesting task.\ntl;dr: This game is probably not what you expected
hoursPlayed: but it's actually pretty good at what it does.\nMore Details:\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YeysHgyCyxE"
votesTotal: 13 of 16 people (81%) found this review helpful

reviewText: An interesting collectable card game that reminds me of Ogre Battle in some ways.  You build a team of up to 5 cards and they automatically battle against the other team.  It's all about match ups, and there is no best combination".  You're always tweaking your card set up depending on what you're up against.  When it comes to the multiplayer
recommended: and it's not pay to win in anyway
hoursPlayed: although it's hard to do well in a league if you don't have a lot of cards.  You set up a team and it fights against other players.  You get cards by playing the campaign
voteText: and you can go through it multiple times.  I find that it's a game that is best enjoyed in small chunks
helpfulPercent: 5 - 10 minutes at a time.\n\nIf you go in not expecting too much
votesHelpful: it really is a wonderful game and one month later
votesTotal: I find myself checking up on it just as much as I did when I purchased it."
column17: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: This is a very nice game and you miss out on that if you ignore it because of the looks" in the presentation. We could use some more Draft players so if you like Card Games jump on this! There are absolutly no micro-transactions and you get a steady feeling of progress. Even the campaign story is not bad at all. The automatic battles are not hampering the fun btw. You have enough to do without the tedious manual battles like in other Card Games. It is really not taking the fun away from this game!\n\nUpdate: I have soon ended the campaing and I think that this has a great replayability as you will get other cards on a new run. These cards also add up in your collection which lets you upgrade your cards to create even better decks for the league. I still think there are to few players in draft and that the league takes to long but I guess both will not change
date: now that the game did not impress a lot of people on steam."
helpfulPercent: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText: I'm 20 hours into the gameplay and enjoying it very much.  (The solo campaign demo, free, took about 5 or 6 hours and it was easier than the later stages.)  I normally play turn based strategy games like Civ 5, so this game has a much lighter and more casual feel, but it's still very intellectually engaging.   It's mostly a card game with a loose framework of a storyline and a fantasy campaign setting.  The gameplay where you will be spending 90-95% of your time is somewhere between tactical combat and puzzle solving.  I find myself saying things like Well
recommended: maybe I will try deploying my berserker opposite that elven archer
hoursPlayed: so he will lose some HP and start attacking more vigorously
voteText: because I need their ghouls to die before their skeletons so they don't keep getting hit point boosts..."  and "Dammit
helpfulPercent: the fire tribe engineer can't be placed next to the air-aligned ballista to repair it."   Also
votesTotal: I just don't have enough 1-point cards to fill out a solid team after choosing my best vampire leader and the armor cracker and the druid.  Even after trying all the different spells I still can't bring down their healer fast enough.  So I guess it's time to go PVP to build up some more gold and buy more cards."   Some other reviewers have criticized the art; it's admittedly an odd mix of "old masters"
commentsCount: and classic dark fantasy art.  But
column17: this is a great buy.  Lots of fun
column18: thought provoking gameplay.   A very smooth
column20: both PVE and PVP.  Check it out!"

reviewText: This game is a unique combat puzzle game. It is unlike anything else I have ever played, but I have found it quite enjoyable to try to come up with an army formation that can beat each challenge. The game seems to have quite a bit of PvE (single-player) content.\n\nI have not yet tried the PvP
voteText: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Fun little game about collecting Cards, building Decks and fighting Battles.

Story is not too intersting and the Artwork style is very inconsitent.
But the system intself is a great mix between being easy enough to get into, but at the same time allowing for tactical card placement.

reviewText: I didn't find selecting a bunch of cards and waiting for an auto-battle to happen fun. If you want something light to run while you watch and eat your dinner then fine, but if you play games because you want to interact with them then this is not your game.

reviewText:
Amazing collectable card game, and it's free after the first purchase!

The battle play itself but it's not an easy game.  There is a lot of challenge in selecting the cards for each battle, it's a very good puzzle game.

It also has a storyline and PvP mode.

There is also drafting PvP, while it is well designed, it is unfortuante that there isn't enough players for drafting so some times it's hard to find a game.

This game is excellent. Every battle is masterfully thought out. It is very rewarding to find the combination of heroes that work together on a specific situation. The online game play is  fun as well. I highly recommend this game to everyone- specially to fans of tactics" games."
